instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Had mild water damage. Replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> twice and <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>

<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> pin 2 and 3  3.3V pin 1 0V

<RESISTOR>R9731V</RESISTOR> 0V

what to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Diode mode in backlight output?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0.571

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Seems high like an issue around the switch trace of <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>. Definitely no short on backlight? Fuse ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Any voltage at pins 2, 3, 4 of J9000?
You don't get image, why looking for backlight???

Check if board has USB activity.
Do you hear chime at least?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Oh wait my bad I thought he said 3.3 at the connector not <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. Yes check for USB activity/chime first

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
No chime or usb activity but have 1.1V vcore.

Bios issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: J9000 0v pins 2 and 3 but 3.3V on pin 4

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: No chime and USB activity points to a whole different issue. Could be a BIOS issue in this case. Try a new one for testing  and keep the old one in case it is the actual issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Also try one DDR3 module at a time, each slot by separate.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
tried new bios and one DDR3 module at a time with no change.

SMC issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Does it start in SMC bypass?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Where was the liquid spill?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
SMC bypass mode made no difference, just fast fan spin but still nothing on the screen.

liquid spill was only in lcd area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
When board properly boots, you should note a drop from 1.1V to aprox 0.8V for CPU VCORE.
LVDS lines go from J9000 to PCH, which could got affected by liquid spill...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Checked and CPU VCORE is at a steady 1.1V and does not drop.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Try to reball SMC.
If no result change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
reballed SMC and no result.

Also changed SMC and still no result. After a few seconds i get one blink from white led every few seconds. Makes no difference if ram is inserted or not.

VCORE still steady 1.1V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
I suppose bad PCH, or CPU.
Can also be something affected by liquid.
Reflow them with good flux.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
replaced <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> and now have chime but still no backlight.

J9000 3.2v pins 2, 3, 4.

Already replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have image?
Post <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> voltage (both pins) and <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>.
Check F9700 and <RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR>.

threads.message:

<TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> pins 1,2,3,4,5 0V    pin 6 12.60V

f9700 12.60V

<RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR> 0V

threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> pin 4 IS 12.60 V and the rest are 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>.
Check first if no short to ground at pin 1.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
no short on pin 1

changed. pin 1 12.60V pin 2  0V pin 3  0V pin 4  0v  pin5 0v  pin 6 12.25V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
You are confused somehow.
Pins 1, 2, 5, 6 are common for <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>...
Please be sure about provided information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Yes sure about current provided information

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
"pin 1 12.60V pin 2 0V"
IMPOSSIBLE!!!
Pins 1 and 2 are common, as 5 and 6 too; all these (four) pins are directly connected inside the <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR> package...
Please, look at the schematic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
mixed up measurements

pin 1 and 2 0v pin 5 and 6 0v pin 4 12.60V

That controls the MOSFET...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Try another screen.
Be sure no corrosion and good contacts at J9000.
L9080 OK?
Also test external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Start using USB OSX.
Also try to acces boot menu.
Voltage pins 21/22 of J9000?

"Also test external video."
Please do the required tests when asked; do NOT wait third time mention...
